definitions.definition: before a particular period of time has passed; during a particular period of time

examples.text: You should receive a reply within seven days.
The ambulance arrived **within minutes of** the call being made.
Two elections were held **within the space of** a year.

definitions.definition: not further than a particular distance from something

examples.text: a house within a mile of the station

definitions.definition: inside the range or limits of something

examples.text: That question is not within the scope of this talk.
We are now within range of enemy fire.
He finds it hard to live within his income *(= without spending more than he earns)*.
The noise seems to be coming from within the building.
There is discontent within the farming industry.
Despite her grief, she found a hidden strength within herself.

wordOrigin: late Old English withinnan ‘on the inside’
